[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-ir-compiler/move-bytecode-source-map/src/mapping.rs] [Function: with_source_code()] [File hash mismatch] Does with_source_code() validate that the provided source code matches the file hash in the source_map definition_location, or can mismatched source code mislead security audits? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-ir-compiler/move-bytecode-source-map/src/mapping.rs] [Function: with_source_code()] [Memory exhaustion] Can with_source_code() accept extremely large source code strings that consume excessive memory, potentially causing DoS in compilation or verification processes? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-ir-compiler/move-bytecode-source-map/src/mapping.rs] [Function: with_source_code()] [Source overwriting] Can with_source_code() be called multiple times to overwrite previous source code, allowing an attacker to substitute legitimate source with malicious code after initial validation? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-ir-compiler/move-bytecode-source-map/src/mapping.rs] [Function: with_source_code()] [Encoding confusion] Does with_source_code() handle different string encodings correctly, or can encoding mismatches cause display issues that hide malicious Unicode characters in source listings? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-ir-compiler/move-bytecode-source-map/src/mapping.rs] [Field: bytecode] [View variant confusion] Does SourceMapping properly handle both Module and Script variants of BinaryIndexedView, or can switching between them cause incorrect index lookups? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-ir-compiler/move-bytecode-source-map/src/mapping.rs] [Field: bytecode] [Bounds checking] Does accessing bytecode through BinaryIndexedView perform bounds checking on all indices, or can malformed source maps cause out-of-bounds access to bytecode tables? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-ir-compiler/move-bytecode-source-map/src/mapping.rs] [Field: bytecode] [Handle index attacks] Can an attacker craft a source map that references invalid function handles, struct handles, or signature indices in the bytecode, causing verification failures or type confusion? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-ir-compiler/move-bytecode-source-map/src/mapping.rs] [Field: source_map] [Deserialization attacks] Since SourceMap is Deserialize, can a maliciously crafted serialized source map with invalid indices or malformed data structures bypass validation and cause crashes during deserialization? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-ir-compiler/move-bytecode-source-map/src/mapping.rs] [Field: source_map] [Function map corruption] Can an attacker provide a source_map with corrupted function_map entries that cause incorrect code location lookups, hiding malicious bytecode operations from analysis tools? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-ir-compiler/move-bytecode-source-map/src/mapping.rs] [Field: source_map] [Location overflow] Can source_map contain Loc entries with extremely large line numbers or byte offsets that cause integer overflow when calculating source positions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-ir-compiler/move-bytecode-source-map/src/mapping.rs] [Field: source_map] [Code offset manipulation] Can an attacker craft a code_map with overlapping or out-of-order code offsets that cause incorrect bytecode-to-source attribution in disassemblers? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-ir-compiler/move-bytecode-source-map/src/mapping.rs] [Field: source_map] [Local name confusion] Can crafted local variable names in the source_map cause confusion in debugging tools, potentially hiding variables with security-critical values? (Low)
